intro: Dubouzetia galorei, commonly known as the Galore's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Dubouzetia galorei is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
